channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-18775] HIVE-17983 missed deleting metastore/scripts/upgrade/derby/hive-schema-3.0.0.derby.sql
item.description:
HIVE-17983 moved hive metastore schema sql files for all databases but derby to standalone-metastore. As a result there are not two copies of hive-schema-3.0.0.derby.sql.

metastore/scripts/upgrade/derby/hive-schema-3.0.0.derby.sql needs to be removed.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Looks like metastore/scripts/upgrade/derby/upgrade-2.3.0-to-3.0.0.derby.sql also needs to be removed since it exists under standalone-metastore.

Ran metastore tests (all plus integration). There are only two failures which are existing(HIVE-18719):

  • testListTableNamesByFilterNullDatabase
  • testGetAllTablesCaseInsensitive
gates Can you take a look at the patch?

-1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12911840 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Investigation into test failure reveals that schemaTool expects to find schema file under <metastorehome>/scripts/metastore/upgrade (e.g. MetaStoreSchemaInfo::getMetaStoreScriptDir has path hardcoded). So moving hive-schema-3.0.0.derby.sql to different path results in bunch of test failure (same for upgrade-2.3.0-to-3.0.0.derby.sql). In short moving these files will break schemaTool.

gates Could HIVE-17983 have broken schema tool for other databases with the move of schema files to different path?

Schematool knows to look in <metastorehome>/scripts/metastore/upgrade due to some code in the pom.xml.  We could put something in the pom to copy both older derby files from metastore and newer ones from standalone-metastore to a directory in target and direct the tests to use scripts from there.  This would avoid needing two copies of the file.

On whether the changes broke schematool for other databases, no, because I made sure that in the distribution they land in the same directory they used to.  So when a user untars the distribution all the .sql files will end up in the same directory they did before.  I tested that that all works.
Thanks for responding gates. I'll see if I could figure out the pom code.
New version of the patch with the pom changes.

-1 overall
